0: Provide airway management interventions including tracheal intubation, fiber optics, or ventilary support.
Respond to emergency situations by providing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), basic cardiac life support (BLS), advanced cardiac life support (ACLS), or pediatric advanced life support (PALS).
Verify availability of operating room supplies, medications, and gases.
Pretest and calibrate anesthesia delivery systems and monitors.
Participate in seminars, workshops, or other professional activities to keep abreast of developments in anesthesiology.

Assist anesthesiologists in monitoring of patients, including electrocardiogram (EKG), direct arterial pressure, central venous pressure, arterial blood gas, hematocrit, or routine measurement of temperature, respiration, blood pressure or heart rate.
Administer blood, blood products, or supportive fluids.
Collect and document patients' pre-anesthetic health histories.
Assist in the provision of advanced life support techniques including those procedures using high frequency ventilation or intra-arterial cardiovascular assistance devices.
Monitor and document patients' progress during post-anesthesia period.
Administer anesthetic, adjuvant, or accessory drugs under the direction of an anesthesiologist.
Assist anesthesiologists in performing anesthetic procedures, such as epidural or spinal injections.
Provide clinical instruction, supervision or training to staff in areas such as anesthesia practices.
Assist in the application of monitoring techniques, such as pulmonary artery catheterization, electroencephalographic spectral analysis, echocardiography, or evoked potentials.
Collect samples or specimens for diagnostic testing.

description.0: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.1: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.2: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.3: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.4: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.5: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.

description.8: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.9: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.
description.10: Assist anesthesiologists in the administration of anesthesia for surgical and non-surgical procedures. Monitor patient status and provide patient care during surgical treatment.

1: Assist anesthesiologists in the preparation of equipment for anesthesia administration.
Administer intravenous fluids and medications as directed by the supervising anesthesiologist.
Monitor and maintain vital signs during surgical procedures.
Help position patients appropriately for surgery based on surgeon and anesthesiologist instructions.
Provide care to maintain patient comfort throughout the procedure, such as managing pain and providing heat or cold therapy.
Assist in the placement of regional blocks or nerve blocks as directed by the supervising anesthesiologist.
Monitor and document the patient's response to anesthesia during surgery.
Participate in the creation and implementation of anesthesia care plans under the supervision of an anesthesiologist.
Collaborate with surgeons, anesthesiologists, and other medical staff to ensure optimal patient care during procedures.
Respond quickly and appropriately to any changes in the patient's condition during surgery.
Maintain accurate records of anesthesia administration and patient responses throughout the procedure.
Participate in post-anesthesia care, including monitoring patients as they wake up from anesthesia and managing their pain relief.
Assist with the transfer of patients to recovery rooms following surgery.
Collaborate with nursing staff to ensure smooth patient transitions between different stages of care.
Participate in continuing education and professional development activities to maintain current knowledge and skills.
Maintain a clean and safe environment in the operating room, following all standard infection control procedures.
2: Assist anesthesiologists in preparing patients for anesthesia administration.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to create anesthesia plans based on patient medical history and procedure details.
Administer anesthesia under the supervision of an anesthesiologist during surgical procedures.
Monitor vital signs and anesthesia levels throughout surgeries.
Respond quickly to any changes in a patient's status during surgery.
Collaborate with operating room team to manage patient care needs.
Provide pain management during non-surgical procedures under the direction of an anesthesiologist.
Operate and maintain anesthesia equipment as needed.
Document patient information, anesthesia administration details, and response to treatment in the medical record.
Assist in post-anesthesia recovery and management of patients after surgery.
Perform routine assessments on patients before, during, and after anesthesia administration.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to develop and implement pain management strategies for postoperative care.
Communicate effectively with surgical team members regarding patient status and treatment progress.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of anesthesia techniques, medications, and equipment.
Participate in quality improvement activities to ensure high-quality patient care.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to educate medical students and residents on anesthesia care.
3: Prepare and set up anesthesia equipment before a procedure.
Assist in the selection, dosage, and administration of anesthetics to patients.
Monitor patients' vital signs during surgery and make necessary adjustments to anesthesia regimen.
Maintain accurate records of patient anesthesia administration and responses.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to develop a preoperative anesthesia plan for each patient.
Respond quickly and appropriately to changes in a patient's condition during surgery.
Perform routine tests on patients before and during procedures, such as measuring blood oxygen levels.
Assist with the insertion of epidural, spinal, or regional nerve blocks for pain management.
Provide postoperative care to recovering patients, including managing their pain and comfort needs.
Collaborate with surgeons, nurses, and other healthcare professionals in the perioperative setting.
Perform patient assessments to ensure readiness for surgery and identify any potential risks.
Participate in quality improvement initiatives to enhance anesthesia care practices.
Assist with airway management techniques during emergency situations.
Educate patients about the anesthesia process, including its risks and benefits.
Stay up-to-date on new anesthesia techniques, medications, and technologies in the field.
Maintain a clean, organized, and sterile work environment to ensure patient safety.
4: Assist in the preparation of patients for anesthesia administration prior to surgery.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to develop anesthetic plans for surgical procedures.
Administer anesthetics, analgesics, and other medications as directed by anesthesiologist during surgery.
Monitor vital signs, electrocardiogram (ECG), and anesthesia equipment throughout the procedure.
Identify and address changes in patient condition during the course of surgery.
Provide continuous monitoring of the patient's airway, oxygenation, and ventilation.
Manage the delivery of oxygen, air, and anesthetic gases to the patient.
Respond promptly to any emergencies or complications during the surgery.
Document all relevant observations, actions, and changes in the patient's status throughout the procedure.
Collaborate with surgical team members to optimize the patient's condition and comfort during surgery.
Implement pain management strategies according to the anesthesiologist's instructions.
Maintain accurate inventory of anesthesia supplies, ensuring they are readily available for use.
Assist in post-anesthesia recovery by monitoring the patient's vital signs and providing comfort care.
Collaborate with nurses and other healthcare professionals during the transition from anesthesia care to general ward care.
Participate in quality improvement initiatives related to anesthesia care.
Continuously update knowledge of anesthesiology through professional development activities.
5: Assist anesthesiologists in the preparation of anesthetic equipment for a procedure.
Provide vital sign monitoring during anesthesia administration.
Administer regional, local, or monitored general anesthesia under the supervision of an anesthesiologist.
Evaluate and document the patient's physiological responses to anesthetics.
Manage airway equipment and suction devices during anesthesia delivery.
Collaborate with the surgical team in maintaining the safety and comfort of the patient during a procedure.
Prepare and administer pain management techniques as directed by the supervising anesthesiologist.
Monitor and maintain anesthetic machine function throughout procedures.
Document observations, anesthetic recordings, and changes in patient status.
Provide post-anesthesia care instructions to patients and their families after surgery.
Collaborate with nurses and other healthcare professionals to ensure smooth transitions between pre-operative, intra-operative, and post-operative phases.
Participate in quality improvement initiatives related to anesthesiology practice.
Conduct routine maintenance and troubleshooting on anesthesia machines and related equipment.
Participate in continuing education and professional development to stay current with anesthesiology techniques and technologies.
Provide emergency care if the patient's vital signs or overall condition deteriorates during a procedure.
Assist in the management of difficult airways, respiratory problems, and cardiovascular instability during anesthesia administration.
6: Assist in the preparation and setup of anesthesia equipment prior to patient arrival.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to develop a personalized anesthesia plan for each patient.
Administer anesthetics, analgesics, and other medications as directed by the supervising anesthesiologist.
Monitor vital signs, oxygenation levels, and other physiological parameters during anesthesia administration.
Implement appropriate adjustments to the anesthetic regimen based on patient response.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all anesthesia procedures and patient outcomes.
Respond swiftly and appropriately to any changes in the patient's condition during surgery.
Provide postoperative care instructions to patients and their families as needed.
Participate in multidisciplinary team meetings to discuss patient cases and develop care plans.
Collaborate with nurses, technicians, and other healthcare professionals to ensure optimal patient care.
Assist in the management of pain and discomfort for patients during recovery periods.
Perform routine maintenance and quality checks on anesthesia equipment to ensure safety and functionality.
Participate in continuing education programs to stay updated on new techniques, drugs, and protocols.
Conduct intraoperative monitoring of the central nervous system function using various modalities.
Emergency airway management in critical situations.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists in teaching medical students, residents, and other healthcare professionals.
7: Assist anesthesiologists in preparing patients for anesthesia administration.
Monitor patient vital signs before, during, and after anesthesia administration.
Position patients appropriately to ensure safe and effective surgical access.
Administer anesthetics under the supervision of an anesthesiologist.
Provide airway management during anesthesia procedures.
Monitor and interpret anesthetic effects on patients.
Assist in maintaining a sterile field for surgical procedures.
Manage patient pain during recovery from anesthesia.
Respond to and manage any complications that may arise during the anesthesia process.
Maintain accurate records of anesthetic procedures and patient outcomes.
Collaborate with surgical staff to optimize patient care.
Prepare and maintain anesthesia equipment for use.
Assist in the transfer of patients to and from the operating room.
Participate in quality improvement activities related to anesthesia care.
Provide education and support to patients and their families regarding anesthesia procedures.
Participate in continuous professional development to stay updated on anesthesia techniques.
8: Assist in the preparation of anesthesia equipment prior to surgery.
Adhere to standard sterile technique during equipment setup.
Administer anesthesia under the supervision of an anesthesiologist.
Monitor patient vital signs continuously during procedures.
Adjust anesthesia levels based on patient response and hemodynamic stability.
Assist in managing difficult airways when necessary.
Provide post-operative pain management as directed by the anesthesiologist.
Collaborate with the surgical team to optimize patient care.
Perform routine intraoperative assessments and document findings.
Respond promptly to any changes in patient condition and notify the anesthesiologist.
Participate in the recovery of patients from anesthesia post-surgery.
Assist with extubation or tracheal care as required.
Collaborate with nurses and other healthcare providers on patient discharge plans.
Maintain accurate and complete records of patient care.
Participate in quality improvement activities related to anesthesia care.
Stay current with advances in anesthesia technology and practice through continuing education.
9: Assist anesthesiologists in the selection, preparation, and administration of anesthetic agents.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists to create and implement anesthesia care plans for patients undergoing surgical procedures.
Monitor patient vital signs throughout the perioperative period, including heart rate, blood pressure, oxygenation levels, and temperature.
Administer medications as ordered by the anesthesiologist to manage pain, maintain patient comfort, and control physiological responses during surgery.
Perform invasive and non-invasive hemodynamic monitoring, such as arterial line placement and central venous pressure measurement.
Assist with the insertion of regional anesthesia blocks for postoperative pain management.
Participate in the setup and maintenance of anesthesia equipment, ensuring proper functioning and safety.
Collaborate with operating room team members to ensure a smooth and efficient surgical workflow.
Manage airway emergencies and initiate advanced airway interventions as necessary.
Communicate effectively with patients, families, and medical staff regarding anesthesia care plans and patient status.
Participate in the post-anesthesia recovery of patients, assessing their comfort, vital signs, and level of consciousness.
Document anesthesia care procedures, medications administered, and patient outcomes in electronic medical records.
Attend continuing education courses to maintain knowledge of new anesthetic techniques, drugs, and equipment.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists in the quality improvement initiatives aimed at improving patient care and outcomes.
Participate in multidisciplinary team meetings to discuss complex cases, treatment options, and patient care strategies.
Provide intraoperative and postoperative analgesia management to minimize patient discomfort and facilitate early mobilization.
10: Assist in the preparation of patients for anesthesia administration.
Administer anesthesia under the supervision of anesthesiologists.
Monitor vital signs and patient status during surgical procedures.
Adjust anesthesia levels as necessary to maintain optimal patient condition.
Provide pain management as required during surgical treatments.
Respond quickly and appropriately to any changes in the patient's condition.
Participate in post-operative care, including monitoring vital signs and administering pain medication.
Collaborate with surgical team to ensure smooth perioperative process.
Document all anesthesia-related observations, interventions, and patient responses.
Maintain and sterilize equipment used in anesthesia administration.
Educate patients on what to expect during surgery and recovery periods.
Assist with airway management as required during surgery.
Collaborate with anesthesiologists in creating anesthesia plans for individual patients.
Participate in quality improvement initiatives to enhance patient care and safety.
Stay updated on anesthesia techniques, medications, and relevant research findings.
Provide emergency care if any critical incidents occur during surgical procedures.
